quest.name: Simple Pleasures
journal: Estinien stands in silence, a grim expression on his face.
objectives: Deliver the hot chai to the villagers.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...May their souls be reunited one day. For that and so many other blessed possibilities, we must avert the Final Days.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You are ready, then?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: In that case, let's head to Palaka's Stand. No doubt Vrtra is awaiting us.

dialogue.name: YERUVVET
dialogue.text: First hordes of beasts, now a mighty wyrm... Our world grows stranger by the day...

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Rest easy, for all is well here.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Young Matsya returned with the babe safe in his arms. Owing to a warm bed, the girl hath already begun to regain her strength.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Less joyously received was word of the mother and father's fate, as well as that of their transformed neighbors...

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: How many children of Thavnair must we lose to this calamity?

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Mothers and fathers, brothers and sisters, sons and daughters... Every death another void that can never be filled...

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: We who survive them must carry the weight of their memory, as we strive to regain a semblance of what we have lost.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Qerasaf and Mehvan's babe is a child of Thavnair as well. I thank you for returning her to us safe.

dialogue.name: YERUVVET
dialogue.text: O, most great and merciful wyrm... I have not the words to express my gratitude...

dialogue.name: YERUVVET
dialogue.text: They say that were it not for you...brave Matsya and the child would have been lost to us forever.

dialogue.name: YERUVVET
dialogue.text: Long had I heard the rumors that a mighty dragon had forged a pact of friendship with the satrap, but never would I have expected such a kind and gentle soul.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Truth in part...but not in whole.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: I am Vrtra, and for years uncounted hath this isle served as mine abode.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: ...An isle I have ruled over as satrap, with Ahewann as my loyal servant.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Are my ears to be believed!? You were the true satrap all along!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Nidhana!? What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I heard from the Radiant that you had gone to help the people of Palaka's Stand in their time of need.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: And so I and several of my colleagues from the Great Work came to offer our services.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: The alchemists have already brewed up some potions for Mehvan's daughter!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: But enough about us─you and your role are the far greater enigma!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: If you were the true satrap all along, could it be that young Varshahn was...created...to serve as your emissary?

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: Thou didst suspect the boy was but a simulacrum?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: A rumor has circulated for many years around the High Crucible that our most skilled alchemists were once commissioned by the satrap's family in secret to fashion a mammet indistinguishable from a living boy.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Looking at Varshahn with that knowledge...I simply put two and two together.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I was not alone in drawing this conclusion. But like me, they no doubt recognized that the satrap was using the simulacrum to work more closely with his people, and decided not to press the issue.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I had always assumed one of Ahewann's associates was manipulating it from afar─though the truth is indeed far more surprising!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: It is an honor to meet you in the flesh, Master Vrtra. Pray allow me to express my gratitude.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: If you had not believed in and given unto us your scales, I do not know where we would be. Thank you...from the bottom of my heart.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas thou and thy fellow alchemists that fashioned the means to unmake the towers. You were the saviors not only of Radz–at–Han, but the star.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Far too kind you are, Master Vrtra...but the star yet wants for salvation. Once more will my colleagues and I commit the knowledge and resources at our disposal to the mission of aiding the people, in this their darkest hour.

dialogue.name: VRITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem this place is in good hands. I would return to see how Radz–at–Han fares. What will you do, Scions?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I worry for the survivors we met at Purusa. Shall we pay them a visit before making our way back?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: In that case, might I ask a favor? Nothing too burdensome, I promise. This way!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Curious, isn't it? The burning sky is so ominous, yet the crackling flames here are somehow...calming.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What a lovely aroma... I wonder what sort of spices those are?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Vrtra chose to reveal his identity to the villagers of Palaka's Stand before all others. A wise choice, considering the warm reception. Heh, he even seemed a little relieved...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It remains to be seen how the people of Radz–at–Han will take the news, but if this was any indication, he need not worry.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! Running through that dark jungle, there was a time when I thought all was lost! Had Master Vrtra and Estinien not arrived when they did...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: ...No. I must focus on the good. Mehvan's precious daughter is safe and sound, and that is all that matters.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Needs to simmer just a bit longer, I'd say...

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I was hoping I might ask you a few questions. The red sky, these terrible beasts... What in the name of the Sisters is happening here in Thavnair?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Oh my, that's rather a lot to take in...

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: ...It would seem the situation is even more grave than we suspected. Thank you, friend. My colleagues and I will use your knowledge to see if it can further our own research.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: ...And with that, here we are! A pot of piping hot chai, brewed from my own secret recipe of spices and tea leaves, together with hearty helpings of rich milk and purest sugar!

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I've made enough for everyone in the village. Might I trouble you to deliver a few cups?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The drink has medicinal properties, then?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Not in the least! The ingredients are quite ordinary. It's so very tasty, though, and has a way of lifting the spirits.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: The spicy aroma and distinctive sweetness of chai is a simple, everyday pleasure on our island. Sometimes the best medicine is the simplest.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A lovely sentiment, Nidhana. By all means, allow us to assist.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: While you lot distribute hot beverages, I'll do a sweep for errant beasts to slay─a far less arduous task, no doubt. When you've finished, look for me at the Wakeful Torana.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I heard that the survivors we met at the temple have all returned safely. The crisis may not have passed, but being home and among friends should do much to ease their spirits.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The aroma of that chai truly is irresistible... Do you suppose Nidhana would mind if I helped myself to a cup?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I would be most obliged if you could deliver a few cups of chai to the villagers. I am certain it will do much to soothe their aching bodies and heavy hearts.

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: Hm...? Wait. I know you. You were the one who saved us from those beasts back at the temple...

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: Were it not for you─well, let's not even think about that. At times like this, we mustn't dwell on what might've been, but look to the future...

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: But what future awaits us? How can Radz–at–Han hope to recover from this? Most of my friends are gone, and I don't know where to turn...

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: A cup of chai? Well, if you insist...

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: Ahhh...that aroma has a way of clearing the mind... Come to think of it, we've faced our fair share of trials in the past as well. And no matter how hard the times, we've always come together as a people united.

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: One day at a time, one step at a time─for that is all any of us can do. Yes... Back to work. Once I've finished this cup. Thank you.

dialogue.name: TIREDMAN04416
dialogue.text: First order of business is securing food and shelter. We also must contact our friends in the city and see how they fare. Hah, no rest for the weary!

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: Look at them all, lazing about! Knowing full well the beasts might strike again at any moment! Do they not realize their lives are in danger!?

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: Well, I, for one, intend to survive! I'm too young to die! Yes, I'll leave this island behind if I must!

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: But...but where would I go? Is anywhere safe these days!?

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: A cup of chai? Can't you see I have more important things to worry about!?

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: No...no, you're right. It is precisely in times like these that we must strive to remain calm and steady.

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: I do believe I'll visit the elder and see what needs to be done. If there is any way I can aid my village and my friends, I will do it.

dialogue.name: NAHBSHAYRA
dialogue.text: Ahhh...how the warmth of the chai spreads through all my limbs... I can't remember the last time I've breathed so easily.

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I... I just want to be left alone...

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: My best friend and I...we fled the village together... One of the beasts took him, and...and...

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: It was all I could do to run. All the while...I could hear this monstrous voice screaming my name...

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: Hmm? This is for me...?

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: Ahh... We used to drink chai together often. Shared stories over steaming cups after a hard day's work.

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: Thank you, friend. The pain may never pass, but I must press on all the same. For his memory, and for we who must remember...

dialogue.name: VISHRYDE
dialogue.text: Many thanks for the chai. It helps me to remember him as he was, cup in hand and a smile on his lips...

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Thank you for delivering the chai, Forename. Did it help to lift the villagers' spirits?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: That is heartening to hear, indeed! The Final Days show no signs of abating, but that is all the more reason that we must try to keep our composure.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Our lives have been forever changed. The people we have lost will never return to us. These tragedies will long weigh on our hearts...

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: But we have the capacity to live with our suffering. To carry the agony till we too join the fallen in death.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: It is not a surrender, but a recognition. For it is only in acceptance that we find the strength to move forward.
